ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hours
one hour
2 hours per week
5 hours
0h
none

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Good!
I really liked the course and having the opportunity to learn more about research being done in biostatistics at other institutions.
It helps us learn many new research progress.
strength: I broadened my statistics knowledge, and it's very helpful for me to choose the area that I would like to pursue in the future.
Quite informative.
Interesting but sometimes beyond our understandings
- There were some talks in which the information was not entirely comprehensible to the students.
Please also invite more industry professionals.
Very diverse speakers, but some of the talks are too hard for first year students to understand.
Some of the lectures make me feel like I am in a biology class but NOT biostatistics
I enjoyed hearing from the different speakers, however I wish there were some speakers from industry and not just academia.
great speakers

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He prepares very well for the seminars.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very helpful professor
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Quite attentive to students' needs and interests.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Responsible, well-done
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very nice job!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Thank you for your efforts. Hope there are more biostatisticians/statisticians in the next semester.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Prof Crawford was always attentive. Also chose excellent speakers

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is helpful!
I think this course is very useful, for us to know more about biostatistics research. I would recommend it to other students.
I will recommend this course to other student. Basically you learned from many great biostatistics professor in states.
Introduce novel topics in biostatistics. Quite informative.
an introduction to different topics of academic research
A seminar based course that invite various speaker to talk about their research.
Yes
It is a weekly seminar in biostatistics. The topics are usually interesting but if you do not have an interest or background in statistics you may find yourself lost.
